root.words: File type not supported in file: {0}
The conversion that will take place. From => To
Please select an input file first
Can't convert two equal file types
Input file is invalid. It's empty
Output file is invalid. It's empty
Failed to play last conversion:\nDid you do a conversion? Did something else go wrong entirely

The file ffmpeg/ffmpeg.exe could not be found. You may have to download it and put it in its folder. Make sure it's in the folder called ffmpeg (Same name as the exe) and that the exe file is called ffmpeg.exe\n\nAs a result, the app can't convert anything. Sorry for the inconvenience
Leaving custom parameters empty will cause conversion to fail. Do you still want to continue?
You need to use {0} and {1} (input and output) in order for conversions to work. Some other actions not reliant of inputs might still work, though. Do you still wish to continue?
Removing -y can cause unexpected behavior if a file already exists when you're converting a file. Are you sure you want to remove it?
ERROR: No input and/or output variables were found in the FFMpeg parameters
WARNING: No -y parameter was found in the FFMpeg parameters. Could lead to unintended behavior.

Created by OnThisPhone. (Hello, Lexicon!)
Made in C# and uses FFMPEG as the back-end for file conversions.
Credits to Eben Sorkin and Mirko Velimirović for SplineSansMono. the font i used in the console window
The app icon was made by Freepik. Convert icon by Komar Dews.

This tool is by no means comprehensive when it comes to how it integrates FFMpeg parameters. It's mostly intended for common types of conversions.
